intro: Gynandropsis pulchella, commonly known as the beautiful gynandropsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, with woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, dry fruits called cypselae. Gynandropsis pulchella is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
